title.narrative: OPT 1. 5. PARENTS AND CAREGIVERS APPLY KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO RESPOND TO THE NEE

description.narrative: 1.5. Parents, caregivers and community representatives have knowledge and skills to care for, respond and manage the needs of children under five years in the municipalities receiving UNICEF support, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Early Childhood Development, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children between 0 and 5 have access to Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) services to guarantee that they survive and thrive, including in emergency situations.

participating-org.narrative: UNIDAD DE ANALISIS DE POLITICAS SOC Y ECONOMICAS

sector.narrative: ECD – Parenting support (including gender responsive parenting) to promote responsive care and early stimulation

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/401 OCM 1. EVERY CHILD SURVIVES AND THRIVES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.5. Parents, caregivers and community representatives have knowledge and skills to care for, respond and manage the needs ofchildren under five years in the municipalities receiving UNICEF support

description.narrative: Approximately 2,577 families with girls and boys in the early childhood phase benefited from awareness-raising and promotion of key practices like loving and sensitive care in the early years. This work was undertaken by the El Alto and Independencia municipal governments with UNICEF support. Behavior change was also promoted by training nine local and national media outlets and by creating educational and communication materials. Currently, key messages on integrated child development are broadcast on social media, television and community radio stations thanks to the partnerships established by UNICEF with national media outlets. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2021

title.narrative: % of boys and girls under 5 years of age whose father and mother has carried out four or more activities to promote IECD in the last three days in intervention areas (El Alto e Independencia)(55919), Text

target.value: 2022:Increase in 10 pp the baseline in Mercedes and Independencia (3.5 and 3.2 respectively) based on INE-EPI survey 2018 with a KAP study.
